page.title: 17PLUCKLEY GHOSTS 6
page.content: {THE MILLER'S}ghost can be seen among the foundations of the ruined mill. The Pluckley windmill was a tall lapped wood constructure with louvred sails which was struck by lightning in 1939 and destroyed. Nothing is known about the ghost and none of the mill's owners met unfortunate deaths. {THE COACH AND HORSES }tends to conjure up pictures of a traditional stage coach drawn by horses careering along country lanes at speed. Pluckley's phantom has never been described in any detail. Some are two wheeled vehicles, others four. Sometimes the horses are galloping or even headless. There may be more than one phantom coach and horses.
